titles.title: To impose a regulatory moratorium and prevent taxes from being raised for 2 years.
To impose a regulatory moratorium and prevent taxes from being raised for 2 years.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform, and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform, and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform, and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet

bill.summary: Prohibits for the two-year period beginning on the enactment of this Act: (1) any federal agency from making any rule that would affect employment levels, and (2) Congress from enacting any law that would result in a tax increase on any person or entity.
